ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Participated actively in defining a target behavior.
Participated actively in defining a goal for the target behavior.
Discussed what is happening before or after the target behavior, as well as specific patterns that occur, during the focused time/setting.
Provided evidence or verbal summaries about use of data collection.
Provided evidence or verbal summaries about use of intervention procedures.
Assisted in creating or improving upon data collection or intervention plans.
Decided upon data collection or intervention plan.
A. Total Score on Primary Behavioral Engagement Components
Provided relevant information regarding this student's strengths.
Provided relevant information regarding this student's needs/challenges.
Shared relevant information about the school/family environment.
Provided appropriate, relevant suggestions or feedback.
Suggested appropriate expectations for this student.
Responded to information shared by the parent/teacher.
B. Total Score on Secondary Behavioral Engagement Components
Communicated agreement/disagreement in a calm manner.
Asked questions for clarification.
Communicated concerns with the parent/teacher in a clear and direct manner.
Used verbal or nonverbal indicators to convey understanding or facilitate the conversation (e.g., um-hm; gotcha; OK).
Maintained involvement throughout the discussion without dominating the conversation.
Acknowledged the concerns, perspectives or ideas of the parent/teacher.
Expressed an understanding of the demands placed on the parent/teacher.
Showed interest/engagement in the conversation.
Shared positive affect.
Provided praise to the parent/teacher
C. Total Score on Psychological Engagement Components
Total Score on Dyad Observation
Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version
